Been to this loaction twice now.  Food was ok but not for the price i paid for it.  They must be REAL proud of their food & drink....The part that really got me was I brought both of my kids with me on the 2nd visit and they ordered off the "kids menu"?  Anyhow, the kids didnt like the food (not thats its coach and willie's fault but kids are picky) as it was a little to gourmet for kids.  However, to charge me for the kids meal and then $3 each for a "kids" drink was crazy.  It ended up costing me $10 for each kid for mac & cheese and a drink.  Usually most resturants include a kids drink with price of kids meal on the kids menu???  Anyhow, if your going to drink beer and watch a game it looks like it would be ok for that but very pricey for what you get....  Not likely ill go back even to watch a game and throw down some drinks with the fellas!
Good place for a beer and burger, had an IPA and it was good. The burger was great and flavorful. Sat at the bar, very helpful and friendly staff. Nice interior and exterior good crowd. Will go back.

I have been here several times. I'm a huge fan of a good ole basket of fish and chips so the first time I ever came here I ordered myself a basket. When they came out they looked so good but when I took a bite they weren't very good. The batter was kind of sweet something I wasn't used to.  On the other hand the other times I have ordered their major league nachos and let me tell you they are the bomb diggity!! They give you a lot it can feed up to 3-4 people. Their fries are good and so is the hummus. So I definitely won't be back for the fish and chips but I for sure will be for the nachos!
OK atmosphere, ok food, run-of-the-mill bar selection.  Def try the meatballs though.

Very nice place with great food, great lounge and lots of TVs with every game on. We eat there alot and the food is always excellent. I would highly recommend this place for a great dinner or just a nice night out for drinks.

Met a business colleague here. Apparently there was some confusion about their grand opening. They changed from a "soft" opening (friends  and family only) to a grand opening on June 3th. Threw me off a bit.  Walked in and immediately impressed - smiles on all the employees faces and pleasantly greeted. The owners no doubt spared no expense (granite counters, gorgeous tile floors, TVs in bathrooms, stainless steel everything, gorgeous bar area)   For being open 4 days it was pretty full - I went for a Monday lunch.  Our waitress was cordial and helpful, since it had been years last time I visited in downtown phoenix.  The menu was limited - they had a sheet printed out. perhaps. This is going to be a negative for some people. Would have been better to wait a little longer and come out with the full menu.  Nice 80s background music that was enjoyable too listen to - not too soft, not too loud. Noise level in the restaurant overall was good (I could hear what my colleague was saying)  I ordered a "Monday" blue burger (only $7 on Monday) and a Mr. Pibb. The burger was outstanding - the time it took to get it wasn't. About 16 minutes from order to arriving at my table (ordered a medium burger).  They had ketchup but no mustard on the table, and did not have fresh pepper in stock. Also waitress didn't put my colleague's dressing on the side as requested. I asked for no onion on my burger but found one there  Waitress could have checked on us a little more, but she did ok overall.  Tab for friend and I came to $18.95, very good for lunch at a place like this.  if it wasn't for slow service this would be a 5-star place.
Not good for kids.  North side patio is smoking and smoke was blowing in.  Gag.  Waitress was quick to take order yet food took 30+ minutes.  Hostess was rude.

I've been to C&W a handful of times. The food & drink are always good. Atmosphere is pretty chill & casual. They happened to be having this beer in a bag thing going on when I was there last night... $2.99 for a "mystery" bottle or can of craft beer...you don't know what you're getting until the server brings it to the table. I gave it a shot. First beer was great. Second beer was an IPA. Not my thing . Had a nice time, as usual.  The main reason for this review is for our server, Jessi. She was out-fucking-standing. Great energy, always smiling, helpful, attentive. Even while her section was full. I hope management @ C&W sees these reviews and fives her the props she deserves! I'll definitely be back & hope I'm seated in her section again.
New menu changes are awesome.  Staff all polite make you feel right at home. Perfect place for fantasy draft, or for just watching Monday nightie Thursday night football with the fellas!

Their food is so good here! Try the Italian Stallion if you like italian subs, this is for you. Bread is delivered from a local bakery and it fantastically crusty. Portions are huge so be ready to share! Chili is so meaty it's enough all on it's own. Love the lobster bisque too. There is so many things to try here, burgers are perfectly cooked.

Love this place!!!!  We don't live far away and probably pass 10 bar/restaurants on our way but the food and service are awesome. We've had just about everything on the menu and we have yet to have a bad meal. Wifey loves the new salad menu as well. Happy hour specials are great and the bartenders will put any game we request on one of their 1000 TVs.   This has become our regular GOTO resto. When we decide to go out to eat and have the regular "where do you want to go?" conversation, we end up at Coach and Willies almost every time. Glad to see they moved to Chandler from the downtown property.   Not sure where the bad reviews are coming from because we have never had anything but a great experience there. I guess some people just need to complain.   Wife and I eat out far too much, probably 10 meals a week and there is no way we would go back if we ran into any of the problems I've read in other reviews. Maybe a bad day for the staff, but not really sure. We've never had a bad experience.   Coach and Willies is our regular spot and will be for a long time.
Horrible, slow service but pretty good breakfast food...drink refills took 20+ minutes after asking the waitress

We went to Coach & Willie's in Chandler with a couple of friends who came to town. On the downside, the place was really loud, even though it wasn't that crowded.  But the vibe was relaxed so that was a plus.  We ordered drinks and then dinner.  The ladies each had salads which were good. My buddy had Salmon Oscar which he devoured.  I had the $15 Prime Rib special.  The steak was great. The garlic potatoes?... Meh.  So overall? Not bad.  Then we ordered a dessert... ("... Nachos"?). It was a sort of sopapilla with ice cream which was the best part of the whole meal.  If I'm in that part of town, I'll go back.

meet up with Aly D on wednesday evening for a glass of wine and dinner- we shared a Mediterranean pizza and i ordered the bbq chicken salad and she ordered the santa fe salad. we decided on this since it was a good deal.. wednesday pizza combo-which includes 1 pizza, two salads, and two drinks.  the pizza was very tasty and loved the fresh toppings. Aly was nice enough to let me take the leftover pizza.  I believe this space was formerly occupied by a porn shop.  anyway it was totally redone and it is a nice & spacious sports bar now.  I really enjoyed my meal so we decided to return for breakfast on saturday and i had the flat belly wrap and Mr h had the steak rancheros- we were pleasantly surprised how delicious breakfast was too. hope they keep up the good job!

This place is nice for a sit down and watch some sports. There is one part...lounge area....that you have to reserve if you got lot of people. The food is actually more of an Italian style yummy food. Try the Italian nachos as it is just seems like eating pasta. The mozzeralla sticks are more like egg rolls but filled with cheese. Good drink menu as well.  I am sure to be back again.
Pretty good food, not too busy at night. Thinking during the day might be a lot livelier. Lots of beer draft choices and good music. I recommend this place

It's 5 o clock somewhere is always my first thought since I love happy hour. =)  I've been here for dinner once but never for happy hour so my friend and I wanted to try it out. Their happy hour is only served in the bar area. I don't really like it when restaurants limit you to a certain area for you to sit for happy hour. It feels too limited and it shouldn't matter where you sit.   We ordered the wings, hummus and some Chicken taquitos. I liked the hummus and the portion was a rather good size. The Chicken taquitos were a bit bland and the salsa it came with was nothing special. I washed it down with some Pinot Grigio which was also mediocre.   All in all, I didn't think it was anything spectacular. The service was on the slower side. It took about maybe 30 minutes or more to get our food but it was busy so that was understandable. I thought it was pretty reasonably priced though since all of this came out to only about $22. =)  Might come back if I'm in desperate need of happy hour since it's super close to my house which is always a plus. =P

I have gone to this restaurant a couple times now and am really impressed with the entire experience. I am a manager for the company I work for and last night I took my crew to Coach and Willies for a team building get together. With 15 people in our group we had a great time and the service was just as good as if I were there alone. Great atmosphere, great menu, great food, and a good selection of drinks! The location is really cool too. Downtown chandler has really come around and is a nice place to get food and walk around to check out the shops in the area. I highly recommend this establishment.

The perfect place for that refreshing recharge after a night out. A wide variety from the healthy to the sinful. Our server, Tonya, was everything one wishes for in the dining experience. Oh, and one can not forget the Famous Bloody Mary.

One things certain, that the service seems to be consistently poor.  I have heard from different people that I need to go to Coach and Willies.  Last Friday night, I finally had the opportunity to talk my husband into going.  It was somewhat late, 9:30ish and the sign said to please seat yourself.  We walked into the bar area, found a table and sat down.  There weren't that many people in there, which surprised me.  Two parties outside, 4 parties sitting in tables inside and a sprinkle of customers around the bar.   We sat there for 10 minutes waiting for somebody to come over greet us and ask us for our drink order or if we were there for dinner.  Nothing.  As a matter of fact, one of the bartenders even came out of the bar area, walked right passed us and kept going.  Really left a bad taste in my mouth.  As soon as he passed me, I looked over at my husband and said "it's obvious they don't need our business.  Come let's go."  He wanted to stay a few minutes longer and I told him "no way".  Will I go back?  Not sure.  What I do know, is they need to step it up on their customer service side or they won't stay in business.  People are dropping apretty penny there and if they want one hit wonders then they've got it.  But repeat business, highly doubtful.    Now, if they are smart, they have somebody monitoring this board to see what they're doing right and what needs to be worked on.

I can't express how amazing the staff at Coach and Willie's is - impossible.  I was in charge of planning a dinner for 100 salesmen from all over the world (that work for our company). Our guests were staying in downtown Chandler so I spoke to every restaurant downtown (and several others around the East Valley).    When I contacted C&W's, I spoke to Kevin, the manager.  He invited my group to come down and sample the menu and see if the space would work for us.  We found that C&W's has a private room, but not large enough for 100 people - so we worked out a deal to rent the entire restaurant for a night.  Kevin and his staff were more than accomodating for the time, serving styles, menu options and atmosphere we requested.  I mentioned that these salesmen came from all over the world - EVERYONE enjoyed the food and atmosphere - forget that this is a sports bar, that's hard to do at any venue.  Our group was so pleased that we undoubtedly will do business with Coach and Willie's in the future - and most definatly visit Kevin and his group when we're off-the-clock as well.    Thanks everyone!

Was here for lunch yesterday, but not my first time. It was after the lunch rush, so easy to be taken care of. Had the lobster bisque and salad. Salad was great, the bisque was a bit on the salty side, but still very good. Will have to try their mac and cheese on of these days!

This is by far the best place in Chandler to catch a game.  We spent four days here during spring training and came here everyday, at least once.  The menu's got tons of choices..  The wings and prime rib sandwich were awesome.  Their happy hour specials were great.  We got to know most the servers and bartenders and thought they were all super friendly.  Definitely a must visit in Chandler.  We'll be back for round two next year!

I guess this place is your typical chain sports bar but with a bit of a country twist. I walked in prepared to hate it but it actually ended up being pretty decent. They had a few choice craft brews on tap in addition to the commercial brands. The burger I ordered was tasty. But what got them a fourth star was the fact that you can get a really yummy spinach salad as a side instead of fries without an upcharge. That is awesome! We may end up finding ourselves here again sometime if the wait at SanTan gets too long.

This place is consistently pretty good. I've been here about half a dozen times and will be back. They have a pretty decent happy hour but their lunch/dinner menu is very predictable. I tried their bacon mac and cheese on my last trip there because the server raved about it -- it was pretty good but not as good as she implied. I wish they had something to make me want to go there, it's close to home, but there isn't a draw for me.

Came here a few weeks ago with my wife & 6 year old. We sat in the "box" which is a cool little side room and had the Lobster Bisque (WONDERFUL!), great local brews (SanTan Brewery!), and the baked Mac & Cheese, which is so wonderful. It was a little loud as the other person said but what do you expect?   I've been back twice since. I started coming here Sunday mornings at 8am to work. They have really fast free wifi (I use to go across the street to Murphy's Law but they've gotten so bad over there!). The breakfasts are just ok. My heart attack had runny eggs when I wanted them well but that's just my thing. The waitresses are awesome. Janeen is a dream and Danielle's been cool. There's two others who I don't know their names... The owner/manager men are really cool. Comped a drink when the price was wrong, put the game on I wanted, and even turned on the sound for MY game (Murphy's Law and RT OSullivan's always refuses to do that!).   [Sure hope they open this early in the spring on Sundays!!!]  I come now, the manager greets me, I get local SanTan drinks, and order the Mac&Cheese. I choose a smaller table out of the main area because I literally will sit there and grade/work for 5+ hours. They're good to their own. Prices may be a little higher than others but  you pay for what you get. Keep it coming!   My only gripe might be is that Eric Stoltz (co-owner) hasn't shown up to sign an autograph & have a beer with me :)

In my mind I was ready to love this place.  I had been asking my husband to go there for weeks.  I tried some of their lobster bisque at TASTE in Chandler and it was yummy.  And then I finally made it there.  I went with my kids and husband, since I was told it was a restaurant, and families were welcome.  Ok, yes, they are welcome, but it is sooooooo loud in there that you can't even carry a conversation.  The patio would have probably been fine, but on the west side the sun was hitting with a vengeance, and the north side was taken up by a radio station.  I ordered the lobster bisque...it's still yummy, but I recommend the small portion cause it's rich and after a while you start hating it.  My husband's wrap looked delicious, but the taste was just ok.  The calamari appetizer was a-ok I guess, I've had much better.   The service, spotty, even though the waitress was pleasant, I have nothing against her.  After a while the dining room started to fill up, and it was already loud before.  We literally escaped (we paid of course) because we couldn't stand the noise level anymore.   The best part were the kid's burgers.  For 5 bucks, they got a pretty large burger, cooked just right (kid's meals are always overcooked elsewhere).  It was tasty.  But the kid's meals didn't include drinks. The prices are no joke...but they do compensate on the portion size.   I may in the future try this place out again, maybe sit in the patio.  It has potential...I see something in there.  And I think my dad would love the ambiance, so I'll probably take him there when he's in town.
